message.content:
cs.RO, cs.CV, cs.AI, cs.LG, cs.CL. 

The paper presents a modular architecture for simultaneous mapping and target driven navigation in indoor environments using convolutional neural networks. This work involves robotics (mapping and navigation), computer vision (semantic segmentation), artificial intelligence (learning a policy), machine learning (CNNs), and natural language processing (semantic targets). Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category is cs.RO (Robotics and Control). However, the paper heavily relies on computer vision techniques such as semantic segmentation, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.CV (Computer Vision and Pattern Recognition). Additionally, the paper involves learning a policy, which falls under cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence). The use of CNNs for semantic segmentation and learning a policy also suggests that the paper could belong to cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
